intro: Oldenlandia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its stems are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence, giving it its common name. Oldenlandia bracteosa is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
